1960s Lee Harrison III experimented with animating figures using analog circuits and with a body suit to create the first motion capture rig
"It was a big patch panel we got out of the junkyard someplace. If you understood the code you could actually see the bones on this panel"
"... we called our machine The Bone Generator because it made sections of lines that could animated or moved in three dimensional space"
10 years later Painbox allowed designers to turn those quaint line drawings into tacky dated period graphics http://t.co/AqeZmHtB
